item.title: Asian financial institutions are expected to see an average pay increase of 4% in 2016
item.description: Limits on variable pay are leading to an increase in guaranteed fixed pay. Asia and Latin America are projected to see average base pay increases of 4.3% in 2016, in contrast to 2% to 2.7% in Europe and North America. Overall, 2016 pay is expected to remain stable, with lower variable pay offset by increases in fixed pay. Source: Mercer. Mercer’s 11th annual Global Financial Services Executive Compensation Snapshot Survey reveals that in 2015, financial services companies worldwide continued to react to regulatory changes.

item.title: Aon Hewitt provides insights on Malaysia's perspective in the Total Compensation Measurement study
